intro: Tacsonia mixta subsp. normalis, commonly known as the common tacsonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, upright stems that bear opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a food source for various insect species and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
